subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|り}}

Probably from {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=り|-}} {{ltc-l|浬}}; however, the {{m|zh|浬}} character does not appear in ancient texts.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|り}}

# a [[nautical mile]]: the [[length]] of roughly one [[minute]] of [[latitude]], 1,852 [[meter]]s

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|かいり}}

From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=かいり|-}} compound {{ltc-l|海里|lit=sea, ocean + unit of distance}}. The single-kanji spelling is an example of {{ja-jukujikun|sort=かいり}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かいり}}

# a [[nautical mile]]: the [[length]] of roughly one [[minute]] of [[latitude]], 1,852 [[meter]]s

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|のっと}}

[[Appendix:Glossary#loanword|Borrowed]] from {{bor|ja|en|sort=のっと|knot|pos=unit of speed}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The kanji spelling is an example of {{ja-jukujikun|sort=のっと}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ノット}}

# a [[knot]]: a [[nautical]] [[unit]] of [[speed]], one [[nautical mile]] [[per]] [[hour]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The katakana spelling {{l|ja|ノット}} is more common in modern Japanese than either kanji spelling of {{m|ja|浬}} or {{m|ja|節}}.
